verbose_text: The reason for using inactive Akt1 / PKBalpha (unphosphorylated) in these studies was to find possible S nitrosylation sites in relationship with the following published data : i) Akt1 / PKBalpha undergoes transient phosphorylation / dephosphorylation which regulates the kinase activity conformation cycle; ii) kinase disulfide bond formation, Cys 297 -Cys 311, and dephosphorylation at pThr 308 are induced simultaneously by H2O 2 oxidative stress in vitro; iii) high levels of nitric oxide production occur both after burn injury and in diabetic patients.
